text_overlay_intent: The text functions as a digital signature and aggressive call-to-action, demanding a visual style that mirrors the 'edit culture' of social media—where the editor's presence is as loud and high-status as the luxury brands listed.
dominant_narrative: A relentless pursuit of speed and prestige, where the mechanical violence of racing meets the polished glamour of the Formula 1 lifestyle.

Intro.supporting_material: Aerial night views, urban billboards, and technical preparation.
Intro.intent_diluting_material: Daytime casual shots or slow-moving crowds.
Intro.reasoning: The intro must establish the 'world' of the edit—high-stakes, night-time, and technologically advanced—to justify the high-energy peak later.

Build-up.supporting_material: Wind tunnel testing, driver training, and pit lane preparations.
Build-up.intent_diluting_material: Generic racing shots without a specific focal point or subject.
Build-up.reasoning: This stage bridges the gap between the 'idea' of racing and the 'reality' of the machine, focusing on the effort behind the speed.

Peak.supporting_material: Crashes, fireworks, onboard perspectives, and podium celebrations.
Peak.intent_diluting_material: Medium-shot tracking of cars that lack a sense of extreme velocity.
Peak.reasoning: The peak must deliver on the 'relentless' promise of the reference, using the most visually explosive and high-contrast material available.

Outro.supporting_material: Victory celebrations, branding backdrops, and reflective moments.
Outro.intent_diluting_material: Abrupt endings or low-quality archival footage.
Outro.reasoning: The outro serves as the 'button,' reinforcing the lifestyle and status elements established by the text overlays.

strengths: Strong night-time and firework visuals matching the reference aesthetic
High-quality technical and training shots to support the build-up
editorial_tradeoffs: Using fictional racing footage (Brad Pitt/APXGP) to supplement real-world F1 intensity
Relying on training montages to maintain energy when racing clips are exhausted
constraint_gaps: Limited 'lifestyle/wealth' symbols (money) as requested, requiring urban Las Vegas shots to act as proxies for glamour

editorial_strategy: Maintain a 'relentless' rhythmic structure by prioritizing clips with internal camera motion and high-contrast lighting. Use the 'technical' clips to create a sense of mounting pressure before releasing into the 'peak' racing sequences.
remake_strategy: To elevate this to a Director's Cut, integrate more macro-photography of engine components and high-fidelity sound design of downshifts to ground the visual speed in auditory weight.
